website_summaries.verdict: A sturdy but inexpensive choice with a lower weight capacity of 150 pounds.
pros: The tubes and feet are capped with rubberized plastic
cons: While working, some owners say the legs may begin to shut

customer_reviews.title: Multiball head not for heavy duty as described.
customer_reviews.text: Structurally the unit is sound. The problem lies with the multi-ball head. The balls don't seem to be rotating witthin a ball bearing enclosure. When weight is applied to the balls they bind. I've applied lubricant to them but that doesn't really help. For light duty work they are fine. Any substantial weight ( a few pounds) will cause them to seize up and not rotate. When this happens during lateral movement of the load the legs lift off the ground and stability of the stand is compromised. The roller is supported by ball bearings. It would have been nice to have the multi-ball support designed the same.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for here. It's kind ...
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for here. It's kind of difficult to keep the head of this stand parallel with the face of the wood coming of my table saw, which caused the boards to "ride up" the roller and pulled the boards to the side while feeding them through the table saw.
customer_reviews.author: reynold miller

customer_reviews.title: work pretty well
customer_reviews.text: I purchase two of these stands and have been using them in different applications for about the last month. They're good but a few times the legs have started to fold shut while using them requiring that I stop what i'm doing and re-adjust them. For the money they are good, just not flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Stay away- unstable
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure how this stand got the good reviews it did?? I have had it for over a year now and every time I try to use it I find it to be unstable. I have tried to use it as an out-feed support with my table saw. The wobble you get from it make it dangerous to use this in this way. What a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: marcus mere

customer_reviews.title: Forget about the instructions they are worthless
customer_reviews.text: Could have been an easier design to assemble, the instructions were two pictures. Be Careful when loosening bolts from bottom support pads there is a piece of metal in the middle that will fall out. You will need a 10 MM wrench for holding back bolts when assembling the head piece. If you buy two like I did the 2nd one becomes much easier to assemble. Once assembled it looks well made and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent accessory
customer_reviews.text: This tool will help me out a great deal with my projects. The manufacturing quality is top rate and the unit is very sturdy. I would recommend this unit to those that are looking for a tool to do the job at a great price and built to stand up with any project it was built to handle.
customer_reviews.author: G. Wade

customer_reviews.title: Plastic tightening handle strips... had to cut off
customer_reviews.text: I truly like the 3 surfaces, straight roller, ball bearing, and flat rest... allows using for multiple needs when cutting long stock. However, the plastic tightening handle strips and becomes useless, rendering the stand useless. I had to cut them off and now use vice grips attached to tightening bolt head in order to use them. Manufacturer should re-think the plastic tightening handle and consider a captured metal handle on the tightening bolt head.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D Gray

customer_reviews.title: It's the helper you always wanted.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nicely made product. I can easily adjust it or my radial arm saw or my table saw. I'm glad that I got a support that not only has a roller, but also ball roller and a stop. It is very stable. I will buy more to handle plywood on my table saw. Folds up easily and stays put.
customer_reviews.author: grizzled old man

customer_reviews.title: Overall a decent work support. Like the muti-head design.
customer_reviews.text: I was a little leary of this unfamiliar brand but overall I'm very pleased with it. You do have to be careful not to overtighten the height adjustment knob as it can strip the threads out of the body. I've repaired mine once and learned what sufficiently tight is. The multiple head positions has come in very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Darin G.

customer_reviews.title: this is helpful to give me the support needed for good straight cuts
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use with my miter saw for a crown molding project. With limited space in my shop, this is helpful to give me the support needed for good straight cuts. Quality is good, the 3 options for supports make this versatile. The adjustments are precise and allow me to get a good level support.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: If you like it wobbly...
customer_reviews.text: While I like the multi-functional head, the way in which the base attaches to the legs is very janky. The whole thing wobbles which can be dangerous because of catching when a board first contacts the head when used as a support for table saw out-feed.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Roller top does not stay on
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these stands, they are pretty well made except for the way the ball roller top is fastened. It is supposed to be pinned to the ends of the regular roller, except that only one end of this roller is long enough to keep the top in place. Both of my stands are the same, and I've tried to see if the center roller shaft didn't spring all the way out. Seems that it is out as far as it will go, and will not keep the top attached. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: K. Yeakel

customer_reviews.title: Works as designed.
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, just make sure you have it facing the correct direction as when you pull material if facing wrong direction stand may fall over. Built very well, would recommend loctite on bottom bolts that hold legs on.
customer_reviews.author: Larey Dunn

customer_reviews.title: Well made stand.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use with a metal cutting bandsaw. It is easy to assemble and adjust. The only issue I had is that it was too tall. After removing a little piece of tubing, it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Travis M

customer_reviews.title: Very good, especially for the price
customer_reviews.text: The flexibility and function of this support is great for the price. The maximum height is a couple inches taller than a lot of cheap roller supports too. Attach it to a heavier base (I used conduit clamps) or put sandbags on the feet for better stability.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dolch

customer_reviews.title: Not stable
customer_reviews.text: The rollers and flip up stop are great. But the legs do not lock in position (as many others have described) and have a tendency to move.
customer_reviews.author: GizmoRN72

customer_reviews.title: adjustment bold stripped threads
customer_reviews.text: Was very happy with these initially, and I read several reviews that seemed to talk about the red handles stripping and becoming useless, which seems to be common on this type of stand in this price range. I didn't have that issue, but the the adjustment bolt did strip the threads from the cage nut mounted on the leg on one of the stands. I will try to use a c-clamp to continue using the stand on lighter loads. Beyond that it has become useless.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent -- couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! I bought two of them and had them assembled in a few minutes. They don't rock, and I can adjust the leg tension to close easily but stay open if I'm moving one of them one-handed. I use them all the time. Very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: It’s alright I suppose.
customer_reviews.text: I thought for the price the roller bearings would have been a better quality but unfortunately they are sticky. The stand is well built otherwise and will work as a basic stand, just don’t expect much from the small rollers.
customer_reviews.author: KAEAM

customer_reviews.title: Assembly instructions are useless, but if you are buying this
customer_reviews.text: Assembly instructions are useless, but if you are buying this, chances are you don't need instructions to assemble and use it anyway. Folds up fairly compact. Sturdy, easy to unfold and adjust height.
customer_reviews.author: uɐʎɹ

customer_reviews.title: This is fairly handy but it tips over really easily when sliding boards along it
customer_reviews.text: This is fairly handy but it tips over really easily when sliding boards along it. If the base were heavier or if the two support legs could be locked it would likely be more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Highcountrybulls

customer_reviews.title: Great Roller Stand
customer_reviews.text: These are very handy to have in any shop. It is well made and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I like the option of flat top
customer_reviews.text: I've already use this numerous times. I used it for a third hand while installing a large, heavy, fixture inside a cabinet. Solid. Well made. I like the option of flat top, roll top, or multiple roller top.
customer_reviews.author: REOmike

customer_reviews.title: Unstable
customer_reviews.text: Light weight construction makes these stands less usable than expected. Works fine on infeed side of table saw but need an assistant to lift onto stand on outfeed side so stand doesn't fall over if stock bows below top of stand surface. If you want a device to allow one person use of a table saw, this is not the one.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: ... how robust they are and the quality is far better than expected Im very happy I ordered two of ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly when I ordered two of these I wasn't expecting much for the price I was really surprised at how robust they are and the quality is far better than expected Im very happy I ordered two of these they far exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: neddyc

customer_reviews.title: Portable, light, easy to use alternative to cumbersome miter saw bench
customer_reviews.text: Easy, light weight alternative for a miter saw bench. Well made for the price.,easy to assemble and portable. Also folds up to take minimum storage space.
customer_reviews.author: MT in Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Useful in many ways
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift and my friend loved it, he ended up buying a second one
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool in my shop
customer_reviews.text: Works great at a fraction of a cost of many other options.
customer_reviews.author: Seavan

customer_reviews.title: Works great as an outfeed table
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great out feed table for my table saw.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Poor design.
customer_reviews.text: The height adjustment locking mechanism broke off within a week of using it. The design is poor as it is only a nut tack welded to the frame rather than threaded hole through the frame. It’s it very top heavy and falls over when wood is in contact with the rollers.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Depee

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the garage shop!
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these. Great set off extra hands in the garage. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect product
customer_reviews.text: I definitely like this product I will buy again this will make my Woodshop complete
customer_reviews.author: Barbara J Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works great as an additional support for lengthy table saw cuts. Love the multi-direction feature
customer_reviews.author: Tommy1234

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality. And for a fraction of price of ...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding quality. And for a fraction of price of it's competition. I bought two.
customer_reviews.author: Jon R

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: It works, but the build quality isn't the best. The metal edges of the single roller were pretty jagged, I covered them with tape to prevent scratching the wood or myself. Also the legs can fold if oriented the wrong way.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Know which roller to use and all is good!!
customer_reviews.text: These works great! Know which roller to use for what you're trying to do. All is good!
customer_reviews.author: Ross C Miller - Author & Editing

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely necessary accessory for cutting long stuff on my table say and my miter saw. It works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Wardonthego

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't sit level on the floor. Yes, ...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't sit level on the floor. Yes, the floor is level. I will try to tweak it but shouldn't have to..
customer_reviews.author: T Cary

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Well built and easy to assemble made to last a good long time.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: but good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was a bit smoother, but good product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mehr

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality!
customer_reviews.text: I own three other roller stands and this one seems to be the best value for the money. The steel is heavy gauge and the stand is sturdy and well-engineered. I love the fact that it combines three functions: roller, ball-bearing, and non-moving support. It requires a couple of minutes assembly involving the four included bolts; if you have trouble with Ikea-type wordless instructions, it might take you longer, but it's straightforward.
customer_reviews.author: kudzu9

customer_reviews.title: The screws included with the roller are too short. ...
customer_reviews.text: The screws included with the roller are too short. The foot keeps coming off because the screw isn't long enough to hold it on. Very frustrating. Will need to go to local hardware to get a longer screw. I can't believe the manufacturer skimped on this!
customer_reviews.author: bonnie paulus

customer_reviews.title: I am super impressed with these stands for the money
customer_reviews.text: VERY HANDY STANDS!!!!!!!!!!!! I am super impressed with these stands for the money. We ended up buying two more after the first one came in. Very pleased. We've been using them for a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Brett O.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I like the three options for how to hold material.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Mac

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product, only complaint is they don't lock open, great value though and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pyro43

customer_reviews.title: I like it for the price
customer_reviews.text: I put it together and where you flip it around to different sides it would come off everytime. I tapped the rod in the roller so it was centered and now it is fine. It seems to be well made well
customer_reviews.author: Bill Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great-Overall
customer_reviews.text: Did the job. Better price than Lowes/Home Depot overprices brands. The 5 rollers are great for sanding projects.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan F

product_meta.title: PROTOCOL Equipment 67109 3-in-1 Roller Stand
product_meta.description:
When the job calls for heavy lifting, turn to the trusted quality of PROTOCOL Equipment. The RS-011B 3-in-1 Roller Stand is an ideal, all-purpose tool designed to support and move heavy material, such as plywood or pipes, in multiple directions. It features one large ball-bearing roller head that can also be used as a material stop. Eight small rollers move independently from each other, helping to move materials in any direction with perfect alignment. The stand is also fully adjustable, with a working height of 28 inches to 45 inches. The wide base features non-slip capped feet to help support up to 150 pounds of material, making this stand the perfect jobsite companion.

PROTOCOL tools are designed to exceed the requirements of entry-level pro contractors and DIY customers shopping in select retailers.
feature_bullets: Supports and moves heavy material in multiple directions
Capped feet and tubes offer stability
Folds up for easy storage and transport
Height adjusts from 28 inches to 45 inches
